200.description: returns an array of secdef info

get.description: Returns the trading schedule up to a month for the requested contract

parameters.name: assetClass
parameters.description:
specify the asset class of the contract.
Available values-- Stock: STK, Option: OPT, Future: FUT, Contract For Difference: CFD, Warrant: WAR, Forex: SWP, Mutual Fund: FND, Bond: BND, Inter-Commodity Spreads: ICS

parameters.name: symbol
parameters.description: Underlying Symbol for specified contract, for example 'AAPL' for US Stock - Apple Inc.

parameters.name: exchange
parameters.description: Native exchange for contract, for example 'NASDAQ' for US Stock - Apple Inc.

parameters.name: exchangeFilter
parameters.description: Response only returns trading schedule for specified exchange

tradeVenueId.description: Reference on a trade venue of given exchange parameter

schedules.description: Always contains at least one 'tradingTime'  and zero or more 'sessionTime' tags

tradingScheduleDate.description: 20000101 stands for any Sat, 20000102 stands for any Sun, ... 20000107 stands for any Fri. Any other date stands for itself.

sessions.description: If the LIQUID hours differs from the total trading day then a separate 'session' tag is returned.

prop.description: If the whole trading day is considered LIQUID then the value 'LIQUID' is returned.

tradingTimes.description: Returns tradingTime in exchange time zone.

get.description: Returns a list of non-expired future contracts for given symbol(s)

parameters.description: list of case-sensitive symbols separated by comma

200.description: returns an object with symbol and and array of its future contracts

get.description: Returns an object contains all stock contracts for given symbol(s)

post.description: The streaming API is documented under [Streaming WebSocket Data](https://interactivebrokers.github.io/cpwebapi/RealtimeSubscription.html) for details.

post.summary: Ping the server to keep the session open
post.description: If the gateway has not received any requests for several minutes an open session will automatically timeout. The tickle endpoint pings the server to prevent the session from ending.
Logs the user out of the gateway session. Any further activity requires re-authentication.

200.description: returned status indicates if user is logged in

confirmed.description: true means username is still logged in, false means it is not

post.description: Initiate a brokerage session to CCP. Only one brokerage session type can run at a time. If an existing brokerage session to iServer is running then call the endpoint /logout first. Note at this time only order management is possible from CCP session, market data and scanner endpoints can't be used since they are only available from iServer session. Work is in progress to provide new CCP endpoints for market data and scanners.

parameters.name: compete
parameters.description: Allow competing CCP session to run

parameters.name: locale
parameters.description: Concatenate value for language and region, set to "en_US"

get.description: Using a direct connection to the market data farm, will provide a list of historical market data for given conid.

parameters.name: period
parameters.description:
Time period for history request. 
  * min: Minutes
  * h: Hours
  * d: Days
  * w: Weeks
  * m: Months
  * y: Years

parameters.name: bar
parameters.description:
Duration of time for each candlestick bar.
  * min: Minutes
  * h: Hours
  * d: Days
  * w: Weeks
  * m: Months

parameters.name: outsideRth
parameters.description: For contracts that support it, will determine if history data includes outside of regular trading hours.

post.description: Session Token Authentication

competing.description: If user already has an existing brokerage session running.

get.description: Provide the current CCP session status. When using the Gateway this endpoint will also initiate a brokerage session to CCP by sending /auth/init and response.

authenticated.description: Login session is authenticated to the CCP.

get.description: Provides the list of tradeable accounts

acctList.description: List of tradeable or Sub Accounts

0.description: For multi-account structures each trading account will numbered from 0 to ...

get.description: List of positions
Get status for all orders

500.description: System error, for example when connection to CCP failed

parameters.description: Order Identifier of original submit order

500.description: System error, for example when connection to CCP failed

put.description: Updates an Order. Updating an order requires the same arguments as placing an order besides the conid. Note: The status of the order can be queried through GET /ccp/order.

500.description: System error, for example when connection to CCP failed

get.description: Get a list of Trades, by default, the list is from today midnight to Date.now().

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: To Date (YYYYMMDD-HH:mm:ss) or offset (-1,-2,-3..). To value should be bigger than from value.

get.description: Validates the current session for the SSO user

expire.description: Time in milliseconds until session expires. Caller needs to call the again to re-validate session

RESULT.description: true if session was validated; false if not.

post.description: Using a direct connection to the market data farm, will provide results to the requested scanner.

value.description: Value can be either an integer, double, boolean or a string depending upon the type of filter specified in the code section

get.description:
Get a snapshot of Market Data for the given conid(s).See response for a list of available fields that can be requested from the fields argument.
Must be connected to a brokerage session before can query snapshot data.
First /snapshot endpoint call for given conid(s) will initiate the market data request, make an additional request to receive field values back.
To receive all available fields the /snapshot endpoint will need to be called several times.
To receive streaming market data the endpoint /ws can be used. Refer to [Streaming WebSocket Data](https://interactivebrokers.github.io/cpwebapi/RealtimeSubscription.html) for details.

parameters.name: conids
parameters.description:
List of conids comma separated. Optional exchange and instrument type can be specified.
  * conid: IBKR Contract Identifier
  * exchange: Exchange or venue
  * instrType: Instrument Type supported values: CS (Stocks), OPT (Options), FUT (Futures), FOP (Future Options), WAR (Warrants), BOND (Bonds), FUND (Mutual Funds), CASH (Forex), CFD (Contract for difference), IND (Index)

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: list of fields separated by comma

post.description: Returns the performance (MTM) for the given accounts, if more than one account is passed, the result is consolidated.

freq.description: Frequency of cumulative performance data points: 'D'aily, 'M'onthly,'Q'uarterly.

post.description:
This endpoint is going to be deprecated. Please use /pa/performance instead.
Returns a summary of all account balances for the given accounts, if more than one account is passe, the result is consolidated.

transaction history for a given number of conids and accounts.
Types of transactions include dividend payments, buy and sell transactions, transfers.

items.description: array only supports one conid at a time.

get.description: In non-tiered account structures, returns a list of accounts for which the user can view position and account information. This endpoint must be called prior to calling other /portfolio endpoints for those accounts. For querying a list of accounts which the user can trade, see /iserver/accounts. For a list of subaccounts in tiered account structures (e.g. financial advisor or ibroker accounts) see /portfolio/subaccounts.

Used in tiered account structures (such as Financial Advisor and IBroker Accounts) to return a list of up to 100 sub-accounts for which the user can view position and account-related information. This endpoint must be called prior to calling other /portfolio endpoints for those sub-accounts. If you have more than 100 sub-accounts use /portfolio/subaccounts2. To query a list of accounts the user can trade, see /iserver/accounts.

Used in tiered account structures (such as Financial Advisor and IBroker Accounts) to return a list of sub-accounts, paginated up to 20 accounts per page, for which the user can view position and account-related information. This endpoint must be called prior to calling other /portfolio endpoints for those sub-accounts. If you have less than 100 sub-accounts use /portfolio/subaccounts. To query a list of accounts the user can trade, see /iserver/accounts.

pageSize.description: How many sub-accounts are returned for the page requested. A max of 20 per page.

accountId.example: U12345678 for Individual Live Accounts, DU12345678 for Individual Paper Accounts

displayName.description: Whichever value is not null in this priority

accountAlias.description: User customizable account alias. Refer to [Configure Account Alias](https://guides.interactivebrokers.com/cp/cp.htm#am/settings/accountalias.htm) for details.

accountStatus.description: When the account was opened in unix time.

faclient.description: If an account is a sub-account to a Financial Advisor.

clearingStatus.description:
Status of the Account
  * O = Open
  * P or N = Pending
  * A = Abandoned
  * R = Rejected
  * C = Closed
  covestor:
    type: boolean
    description: Is a Covestor Account
  parent:
    type: object
    properties:
      mmc:
        type: array
        items:
          type: string
          description: Money Manager Client (MMC) Account
      accountId:
        type: string
        description: Account Number for Money Manager Client
      isMParent:
        type: boolean
        description: Is MM a Parent Account
      isMChild:
        type: boolean
        description: Is MM a Child Account
      isMultiplex:
        type: boolean
        description: Is a Multiplex Account. These are account models with individual account being parent and managed account being child.
  desc:
    type: string
    description: Formatted "accountId - accountAlias"

get.description: Account information related to account Id /portfolio/accounts or /portfolio/subaccounts must be called prior to this endpoint.

200.description: returns an object of three different allocations

get.description: Returns a list of positions for the given account. The endpoint supports paging, page's default size is 30 positions. /portfolio/accounts or /portfolio/subaccounts must be called prior to this endpoint.

parameters.description: declare the table to be sorted by which column

parameters.name: direction
parameters.description: in which order, a means ascending - d means descending

parameters.name: period
parameters.description: period for pnl column, can be 1D, 7D, 1M...

200.description: returns a list of positions in the portfolio

get.description: Returns a list of all positions matching the conid. For portfolio models the conid could be in more than one model, returning an array with the name of the model it belongs to.  /portfolio/accounts or /portfolio/subaccounts must be called prior to this endpoint.

200.description: returns a list containing only one position for the conid

post.summary: Invalidates the backend cache of the Portfolio

get.description: Returns information about margin, cash balances and other information related to specified account. See also /portfolio/{accountId}/ledger. /portfolio/accounts or /portfolio/subaccounts must be called prior to this endpoint.

200.description: returns an object containing account summary. The object contains multiple properties. A property is sufficed with -c if its provides commodity value, -s if it provides security value and -c if its UKL segment value

get.description: Information regarding settled cash, cash balances, etc. in the account's base currency and any other cash balances hold in other currencies.  /portfolio/accounts or /portfolio/subaccounts must be called prior to this endpoint. The list of supported currencies is available at https://www.interactivebrokers.com/en/index.php?f=3185.

Returns an object of all positions matching the conid for all the selected accounts. For portfolio models the conid could be in more than one model, returning an array with the name of the model it belongs to. /portfolio/accounts or /portfolio/subaccounts must be called prior to this endpoint.

200.description: returns an object containing account and its position information

post.description: Current Authentication status to the Brokerage system. Market Data and Trading is not possible if not authenticated, e.g. authenticated shows false
When using the CP Gateway, this endpoint provides a way to reauthenticate to the Brokerage system as long as there is a valid SSO session, see /sso/validate.

get.summary: List of Trades for the selected account
get.description: Returns a list of trades for the currently selected account for current day and six previous days. It is advised to call this endpoint once per session.

Returns a list of accounts the user has trading access to, their respective aliases and the currently selected account. Note this endpoint must be called before modifying an order or querying open orders.

post.description: If an user has multiple accounts, and user wants to get orders, trades, etc. of an account other than currently selected account, then user can update the currently selected account using this API and then can fetch required information for the newly updated account.

200.description: an object containing updated account ID

post.description: Please note here, DO NOT pass orderId when creating a new alert, toolId is only required for MTA alert

get.summary: Get a list of available alerts
get.description: The response will contain both active and inactive alerts, but it won't have MTA alert

alert_active.description: Value can only be 0 or 1, 1 means active

order_time.description: format, YYYYMMDD-HH:mm:ss, the time when you created the alert

alert_triggered.description: whether the alert has been triggered or not

alert_repeatable.description: whether the alert can be repeatable or not, value can be 1 or 0. 1 means true

post.description: Please note, if alertId is 0, it will activate/deactivate all alerts

delete.description: Please be careful, if alertId is 0, it will delete all alerts

get.description:
Use the endpoint /iserver/account/:accountId/alerts to receive the alert id.
The order_id in the response is the alert id.

Each login user only has one mobile trading assistant (MTA) alert with it's own unique tool id.
The tool id cannot be changed. When modified a new order Id is generated. MTA alerts can not
be created or deleted. If you call delete /iserver/account/:accountId/alert/:alertId,
it will reset MTA to default. See [here](https://www.interactivebrokers.com/en/software/mobileiphonemobile/mobileiphone.htm#monitor/trading-assistant.htm) for more information on MTA alerts.

The endpoint is meant to be used in polling mode, e.g. requesting every x seconds.
The response will contain two objects, one is notification, the other is orders.
Orders is the list of live orders (cancelled, filled, submitted).
Notifications contains information about execute orders as they happen, see status field.
To receive streaming live orders the endpoint /ws can be used. Refer to [Streaming WebSocket Data](https://interactivebrokers.github.io/cpwebapi/RealtimeSubscription.html) for details.

parameters.name: Filters
parameters.description: list of filters separated by comma

items.description:
Only return list of orders for filter value. More than one filter can be specified comma separated.
  * inactive: Order was received by the system but is no longer active because it was rejected or cancelled.
  * pending_submit: Order has been transmitted but have not received confirmation yet that order accepted by destination exchange or venue.
  * pre_submitted: Simulated order transmitted but the order has yet to be elected. Order is held by IB system until election criteria are met.
  * submitted: Order has been accepted by the system.
  * filled: Order has been completely filled.
  * pending_cancel: Sent an order cancellation request but have not yet received confirmation order cancelled by destination exchange or venue.
  * cancelled: The balance of your order has been confirmed canceled by the system.
  * warn_state: Order has a specific warning message such as for basket orders.
  * sort_by_time: There is an initial sort by order state performed so active orders are always above inactive and filled then orders are sorted chronologically.

conidex.description: conid and exchange. Format supports conid or conid@exchange

sizeAndFills.description: Quantity outstanding and total quantity concatenated with forward slash separator

supportsTaxOpt.description: Supports Tax Optimization with 0 for no and 1 for yes

lastExecutionTime.description: Last status update in format YYMMDDhhmms based in GMT

lastExecutionTime_r.description: Last status update unix time in ms

side.description:
The side of the market of the order.
 * BUY: Buy contract near posted ask price
 * SELL: Sell contract near posted bid price
 * ASSN: Option Assignment, if BUYSELL=BUY and OptionType=PUT or BUYSELL=SELL and OptionType=CALL
 * EXER: Option Exercise, if BUYSELL=SELL and OptionType=PUT or BUYSELL=BUY and OptionType=CALL

snapshot.description: If live order update is a snapshot

post.description:
This endpoint is going to be deprecated, you can use /iserver/account/{accountId}/orders, just pass one order
in the array, the order structure will be same.
Please note here, sometimes this endpoint alone can't make sure you submit the order successfully,
you could receive some questions in the response, you have to to answer them in order to submit the order
successfully. You can use "/iserver/reply/{replyid}" endpoint to answer questions

message.description:
Please note here, if the message is a question, you have to reply to question in order to submit
the order successfully. See more in the "/iserver/reply/{replyid}" endpoint.

post.description:
When connected to an IServer Brokerage Session, this endpoint will allow you to submit orders. 
CP WEB API supports various advanced orderTypes, for additional details and examples refer to [IBKR Quant Blog](https://www.tradersinsight.news/category/ibkr-quant-news/programming_languages/rest-development/).
  * Bracket - Attach additional opposite-side order(s) by using a single **cOID** sent with the parent and set the same value for **parentId** in each child order(s).
  * Cash Quantity -  Send orders using monetary value by specifying **cashQty** instead of quantity, e.g. cashQty: 200. The endpoint /iserver/contract/rules returns list of valid orderTypes in cqtTypes.
  * Currency Conversion - Convert cash from one currency to another by including **isCcyConv** = **true**. To specify the cash quantity use **fxQTY** instead of quantity, e.g. fxQTY: 100.
  * Fractional - Contracts that support fractional shares can be traded by specifying **quantity** as a float, e.g. quantity: 0.001. The endpoint /iserver/contract/rules returns a list of valid orderTypes in fraqTypes.
  * IB Algos - Attached user-defined settings to your trades by using any of IBKR's Algo Orders. Use the endpoint /iserver/contract/{conid}/algos to identify the available strategies for a contract.
  * One-Cancels-All (OCA) - Group multiple unrelated orders by passing order request info in an array and including **isSingleGroup = true** for each order. All orders will be assigned the same oca_group_id.

orders.description:
Notes for bracket orders: 1. Children orders will not have its own "cOID", so please donot pass "cOID"
parameter in child order.Instead, they will have a "parentId" which must be equal to "cOID" of parent.
2. When you cancel a parent order, it will cancel all bracket orders, when you cancel one child order,
it will also cancel its sibling order.

message.description:
Please note here, if the message is a question, you have to reply to question in order to submit
the order successfully. See more in the "/iserver/reply/{replyid}" endpoint.

post.description:
Financial Advisors can use this endpoint to place an order for a specified group. To place an order for a specified account use the endpoint /iserver/account/{accountId}/order.
More information about groups can be found in the [TWS Users' Guide:](https://guides.interactivebrokers.com/twsguide/twsguide.htm#usersguidebook/financialadvisors/create_an_account_group_for_share_allocation.htm).

message.description:
Please note here, if the message is a question, you have to reply to question in order to submit
the order successfully. See more in the "/iserver/reply/{replyid}" endpoint.

post.description: Reply to questions when placing orders and submit orders

parameters.name: replyid
parameters.description: Please use the "id" from the response of "Place Order" endpoint

confirmed.description: answer to question, true means yes, false means no

200.description: Order is submitted successfully, returns an array contains one object

400.description: When you send "confirmed-false" in the request, you will receive this

post.description:
This end-point is going to be deprecated, you can use /iserver/account/{accountId}/orders/whatif,
just pass one order in the array, the order structure will be same.
This endpoint allows you to preview order without actually submitting the order and you can get
commission information in the response.

This endpoint allows you to preview order without actually submitting the order and you can get
commission information in the response. Also supports bracket orders.

orders.description:
Notes for bracket orders: 1. Children orders will not have its own "cOID", so please donot pass "cOID"
parameter in child order.Instead, they will have a "parentId" which must be equal to "cOID" of parent.
2. When you cancel a parent order, it will cancel all bracket orders, when you cancel one child order,
it will also cancel its sibling order.

parameters.name: orderId
parameters.description: Customer order id, use /iservers/account/orders endpoint to query orderId.

post.description: Modifies an open order. Must call /iserver/accounts endpoint prior to modifying an order. Use /iservers/account/orders endpoint to review open-order(s).

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: account id, or fa group if modifying a group order

parameters.name: orderId
parameters.description: Customer order id, use /iservers/account/orders endpoint to query orderId.

delete.description: Cancels an open order. Must call /iserver/accounts endpoint prior to cancelling an order. Use /iservers/account/orders endpoint to review open-order(s) and get latest order status.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: account id, or fa group if deleting a group order

parameters.name: orderId
parameters.description: Customer order id, use /iservers/account/orders endpoint to query orderId.

200.description: returns an object with order id, message, conid and account id

get.description:
Get Market Data for the given conid(s). The endpoint will return by default bid, ask, last, change, change pct, close, listing exchange.
See response fields for a list of available fields that can be request via fields argument.
The endpoint /iserver/accounts must be called prior to /iserver/marketdata/snapshot.
For derivative contracts the endpoint /iserver/secdef/search must be called first.
First /snapshot endpoint call for given conid will initiate the market data request. 
To receive all available fields the /snapshot endpoint will need to be called several times.
To receive streaming market data the endpoint /ws can be used. Refer to [Streaming WebSocket Data](https://interactivebrokers.github.io/cpwebapi/RealtimeSubscription.html) for details.

parameters.name: conids
parameters.description: list of conids separated by comma

parameters.name: since
parameters.description: time period since which updates are required. uses epoch time with milliseconds.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: list of fields separated by comma

31.description:
Last Price - The last price at which the contract traded. May contain one of the following prefixes:
  * C - Previous day's closing price.
  * H - Trading has halted.

73.description: Market Value - The current market value of  your position in the security. Market Value is calculated with real time market data (even when not subscribed to market data).

74.description: Avg Price - The average price of the position.

75.description: Unrealized PnL - Unrealized profit or loss. Unrealized PnL is calculated with real time market data (even when not subscribed to market data).

78.description: Daily PnL - Your profit or loss of the day since prior close. Daily PnL is calculated with real time market data (even when not subscribed to market data).

79.description: Realized PnL - Realized profit or loss. Realized PnL is calculated with real time market data (even when not subscribed to market data).

80.description: Unrealized PnL % - Unrealized profit or loss expressed in percentage.

82.description: Change - The difference between the last price and the close on the previous trading day

83.description: Change % - The difference between the last price and the close on the previous trading day in percentage.

84.description: Bid Price - The highest-priced bid on the contract.

85.description: Ask Size - The number of contracts or shares offered at the ask price. For US stocks, the number displayed is divided by 100.

86.description: Ask Price - The lowest-priced offer on the contract.

87.description: Volume - Volume for the day, formatted with 'K' for thousands or 'M' for millions. For higher precision volume refer to field 7762.

87_raw (deprecated).description: Raw Volume - Volume for the day, provided in long form without formatted with K/M. This field value is deprecated, for high precision volume refer to field 7762.

88.description: Bid Size - The number of contracts or shares bid for at the bid price. For US stocks, the number displayed is divided by 100.

6008.description: Conid - Contract identifier from IBKR's database.

6070.description: SecType - The asset class of the instrument.

6119.description: Marker for market data delivery method (similar to request id)

6457.description: Underlying Conid. Use /trsrv/secdef to get more information about the security

6509.description:
Market Data Availability. The field may contain three chars. First char defines: R = RealTime, D = Delayed,
Z = Frozen, Y = Frozen Delayed, N = Not Subscribed. Second char defines: P = Snapshot, p = Consolidated.
Third char defines: B = Book
  * RealTime - Data is relayed back in real time without delay, market data subscription(s) are required.
  * Delayed - Data is relayed back 15-20 min delayed. 
  * Frozen - Last recorded data at market close, relayed back in real time.
  * Frozen Delayed - Last recorded data at market close, relayed back delayed.
  * Not Subscribed - User does not have the required market data subscription(s) to relay back either real time or delayed data.
  * Snapshot - Snapshot request is available for contract.
  * Consolidated - Market data is aggregated across multiple exchanges or venues.
  * Book - Top of the book data is available for contract.

7057.description: Ask Exch - Displays the exchange(s) offering the SMART price. A=AMEX, C=CBOE, I=ISE, X=PHLX, N=PSE, B=BOX, Q=NASDAQOM, Z=BATS, W=CBOE2, T=NASDAQBX, M=MIAX, H=GEMINI, E=EDGX, J=MERCURY

7058.description: Last Exch - Displays the exchange(s) offering the SMART price. A=AMEX, C=CBOE, I=ISE, X=PHLX, N=PSE, B=BOX, Q=NASDAQOM, Z=BATS, W=CBOE2, T=NASDAQBX, M=MIAX, H=GEMINI, E=EDGX, J=MERCURY

7059.description: Last Size - The number of unites traded at the last price

7068.description: Bid Exch - Displays the exchange(s) offering the SMART price. A=AMEX, C=CBOE, I=ISE, X=PHLX, N=PSE, B=BOX, Q=NASDAQOM, Z=BATS, W=CBOE2, T=NASDAQBX, M=MIAX, H=GEMINI, E=EDGX, J=MERCURY

7084.description: Implied Vol./Hist. Vol % - The ratio of the implied volatility over the historical volatility, expressed as a percentage.

7085.description: Put/Call Interest - Put option open interest/call option open interest for the trading day.

7086.description: Put/Call Volume - Put option volume/call option volume for the trading day.

7088.description: Hist. Vol. Close % - Shows the historical volatility based on previous close price.

7184.description: canBeTraded - If contract is a trade-able instrument. Returns 1(true) or 0(false).

7280.description: Industry - Displays the type of industry under which the underlying company can be categorized.

7281.description: Category - Displays a more detailed level of description within the industry under which the underlying company can be categorized.

7282.description: Average Volume - The average daily trading volume over 90 days.

7283.description:
Option Implied Vol. % - A prediction of how volatile an underlying will be in the future.
At the market volatility estimated for a maturity thirty calendar days forward of the current trading day, and based on option prices from two consecutive expiration months.
To query the Implied Vol. % of a specific strike refer to field 7633.

7286.description: Dividend Amount - Displays the amount of the next dividend.

7287.description:
Dividend Yield % - This value is the toal of the expected dividend payments over the next twelve months per share divided by the Current Price and is expressed as a percentage.
For derivatives, this displays the total of the expected dividend payments over the expiry date.

7292.description: Cost Basis - Your current position in this security multiplied by the average price and multiplier.

7293.description: 52 Week High - The highest price for the past 52 weeks.

7294.description: 52 Week Low - The lowest price for the past 52 weeks.

7308.description: Delta - The ratio of the change in the price of the option to the corresponding change in the price of the underlying.

7309.description: Gamma - The rate of change for the delta with respect to the underlying asset's price.

7310.description: Theta - A measure of the rate of decline the value of an option due to the passage of time.

7311.description: Vega - The amount that the price of an option changes compared to a 1% change in the volatility.

7607.description: Opt. Volume Change % - Today's option volume as a percentage of the average option volume.

7633.description: Implied Vol. % - The implied volatility for the specific strike of the option in percentage. To query the Option Implied Vol. % from the underlying refer to field 7283.

7635.description: Mark - The mark price is, the ask price if ask is less than last price, the bid price if bid is more than the last price, otherwise it's equal to last price.

7636.description: Shortable Shares - Number of shares available for shorting.

7637.description: Fee Rate - Interest rate charged on borrowed shares.

7639.description:
% of Mark Value - Displays the market value of the contract as a percentage of the total market value of the account.
Mark Value is calculated with real time market data (even when not subscribed to market data).

7644.description: Shortable - Describes the level of difficulty with which the security can be sold short.

7655.description: Morningstar Rating - Displays Morningstar Rating provided value. Requires [Morningstar](https://www.interactivebrokers.com/en/index.php?f=14262) subscription.

7671.description: Dividends - This value is the total of the expected dividend payments over the next twelve months per share.

7672.description: Dividends TTM - This value is the total of the expected dividend payments over the last twelve months per share.

7678.description: Price/EMA(200) - Price to Exponential moving average (N=200) ratio -1, displayed in percents.

7679.description: Price/EMA(100) - Price to Exponential moving average (N=100) ratio -1, displayed in percents.

7680.description: Price/EMA(50) - Price to Exponential moving average (N=50) ratio -1, displayed in percents.

7681.description: Price/EMA(20) - Price to Exponential moving average (N=20) ratio -1, displayed in percents.

7682.description: Change Since Open - The difference between the last price and the open price.

7683.description: Upcoming Event - Shows the next major company event. Requires [Wall Street Horizon](https://www.interactivebrokers.com/en/index.php?f=24674) subscription.

7684.description: Upcoming Event Date - The date of the next major company event. Requires [Wall Street Horizon](https://www.interactivebrokers.com/en/index.php?f=24674) subscription.

7685.description: Upcoming Analyst Meeting - The date and time of the next scheduled analyst meeting. Requires [Wall Street Horizon](https://www.interactivebrokers.com/en/index.php?f=24674) subscription.

7686.description: Upcoming Earnings - The date and time of the next scheduled earnings/earnings call event. Requires [Wall Street Horizon](https://www.interactivebrokers.com/en/index.php?f=24674) subscription.

7687.description: Upcoming Misc Event - The date and time of the next shareholder meeting, presentation or other event. Requires [Wall Street Horizon](https://www.interactivebrokers.com/en/index.php?f=24674) subscription.

7688.description: Recent Analyst Meeting - The date and time of the most recent analyst meeting. Requires [Wall Street Horizon](https://www.interactivebrokers.com/en/index.php?f=24674) subscription.

7689.description: Recent Earnings - The date and time of the most recent earnings/earning call event. Requires [Wall Street Horizon](https://www.interactivebrokers.com/en/index.php?f=24674) subscription.

7690.description: Recent Misc Event - The date and time of the most recent shareholder meeting, presentation or other event. Requires [Wall Street Horizon](https://www.interactivebrokers.com/en/index.php?f=24674) subscription.

7694.description: Probability of Max Return - Customer implied probability of maximum potential gain.

7696.description: SPX Delta - Beta Weighted Delta is calculated using the formula; Delta x dollar adjusted beta, where adjusted beta is adjusted by the ratio of the close price.

7697.description: Futures Open Interest - Total number of outstanding futures contracts

7698.description:
Last Yield - Implied yield of the bond if it is purchased at the current last price. Last yield is calculated using the Last price on all possible call dates.
It is assumed that prepayment occurs if the bond has call or put provisions and the issuer can offer a lower coupon rate based on current market rates.
The yield to worst will be the lowest of the yield to maturity or yield to call (if the bond has prepayment provisions). Yield to worse may be the same as yield to maturity but never higher.

7699.description:
Bid Yield - Implied yield of the bond if it is purchased at the current bid price. Bid yield is calculated using the Ask on all possible call dates.
It is assumed that prepayment occurs if the bond has call or put provisions and the issuer can offer a lower coupon rate based on current market rates.
The yield to worst will be the lowest of the yield to maturity or yield to call (if the bond has prepayment provisions). Yield to worse may be the same as yield to maturity but never higher.

7700.description: Probability of Max Return - Customer implied probability of maximum potential gain.

7702.description: Probability of Max Loss - Customer implied probability of maximum potential loss.

7703.description: Profit Probability - Customer implied probability of any gain.

7706.description: Ratings - Ratings issued for bond contract.

7718.description: Beta - Beta is against standard index.

7720.description:
Ask Yield - Implied yield of the bond if it is purchased at the current offer. Ask yield is calculated using the Bid on all possible call dates.
It is assumed that prepayment occurs if the bond has call or put provisions and the issuer can offer a lower coupon rate based on current market rates.
The yield to worst will be the lowest of the yield to maturity or yield to call (if the bond has prepayment provisions). Yield to worse may be the same as yield to maturity but never higher.

7762.description: Volume Long - High precision volume for the day. For formatted volume refer to field 87.

7768.description: hasTradingPermissions - if user has trading permissions for specified contract. Returns 1(true) or 0(false).

400.description: sent when accounts are not queried before sending this request

get.description: Cancel market data for given conid. To cancel all market data request(s), see /iserver/marketdata/unsubscribeall.

200.description: confirms market data for conid is cancelled

confirmed.description: success means market data was cancelled.

get.description: Cancel all market data request(s). To cancel market data for given conid, see /iserver/marketdata/{conid}/unsubscribe.

confirmed.description: true means market data is cancelled, false means it is not.

get.description:
Get historical market Data for given conid, length of data is controlled by 'period' and 'bar'.
Formatted as: min=minute, h=hour, d=day, w=week, m=month, y=year
e.g. period =1y with bar =1w returns 52 data points (Max of 1000 data points supported).
**Note**: There's a limit of 5 concurrent requests. Excessive requests will return a 'Too many requests' status 429 response.

parameters.name: exchange
parameters.description: Exchange of the conid (e.g. ISLAND, NYSE, etc.). Default value is empty which corresponds to primary exchange of the conid.

parameters.name: outsideRth
parameters.description: For contracts that support it, will determine if historical data includes outside of regular trading hours.

get.description: Using the Contract Identifier get contract info. You can use this to prefill your order before you submit an order

post.description:
Search by underlying symbol or company name. Relays back what derivative contract(s) it has. This endpoint must be called before using /secdef/info.
If company name is specified will only receive limited response: conid, companyName, companyHeader and symbol.

parameters.name: symbol
parameters.description: Symbol or Company Name to be searched

symbol.description: symbol or name to be searched

name.description: should be true if the search is to be performed by name. false by default.

secType.description: If search is done by name, only the assets provided in this field will be returned. Currently, only STK is supported.

fop.description: List of Future Option expirations in YYYMMDD format separated by semicolon

opt.description: List of Option expirations in YYYYMMDD format separated by semicolon

war.description: List of Warrant expirations in YYYYMMDD format separated by semicolon

months.description: List of expiration month(s) and year(s) in MMMYY format separated by semicolon

legSecType.description: For combo's defines the asset class for each leg

get.description: Query strikes for Options/Warrants. For the conid of the underlying contract, available contract months and exchanges use "/iserver/secdef/search"

parameters.name: conid
parameters.description: contract id of the underlying contract

200.description: returns an object contains call/put strike prices

get.description: Provides Contract Details of Futures, Options, Warrants, Cash and CFDs based on conid. To get the strike price for Options/Warrants use "/iserver/secdef/strikes" endpoint. Must call /secdef/search for the underlying contract first.

parameters.name: month
parameters.description: contract month, only required for FUT/OPT/WAR in the format MMMYY, example JAN00

parameters.name: right
parameters.description: C for call, P for put

get.description: Returns supported IB Algos for contract. Must be called a second time to query the list of available parameters.

parameters.name: algos
parameters.description: List of algo ids delimited by ";" to filter by. Max of 8 algos ids can be specified.

parameters.name: addDescription
parameters.description: Whether or not to add algo descriptions to response. Set to 1 for yes, 0 for no.

parameters.name: addParams
parameters.description: Whether or not to show algo parameters.  Set to 1 for yes, 0 for no.

required.description: If true a value must be entered.

minValue.description: Smallest value, only applies to parameters with valueClassName=Double.

maxValue.description: Largest value, only applies to parameters with valueClassName=Double.

defaultValue.description: User configured preset for this parameter.

guiRank.description: The order in UI, used when building dynamic UI so that more important parameters are presented first.

priceMarketRule.description: If true, must specify parameter using market rule format. Only applies to parameters with valueClassName=Double.

enabledConditions.description:
The rules that UI should apply to algo parameters depending on chosen order type:
 * MKT:speedUp:=:no - hide SpeedUp param when MKT is chosen for order type.
 * LMT:strategyType:<>:empty - strategyType param cannot be empty when LMT is chosen for order type.
 * MKT:strategyType:=:Marketable - set strategyType param to Marketable and disable (no other choice) when MKT is chosen for order type.

post.description: Returns trading related rules for a specific contract and side. For both contract info and rules use the endpoint /iserver/contract/{conid}/info-and-rules.

isBuy.description: Side of the market rules apply too. Set to **true** for Buy Orders, set to **false** for Sell Orders

0.description: List of Accounts that can be traded

error.description: Returns a description on any errors with order presets

0.description: order types that support IB Algos
order types that support fractional trades
order types that support cash quantity trades

orderDefaults.description: If object returned will provide the defaults based on user settings

0.description: order types that support outside of regular trading hours
Time in Force values, formatted with o for supporting Outside regular trading hours and a for Algo trading

orderOrigination.description: Order origin designation for US securities options and Options Clearing Corporation

fraqInt.description: decimal places for fractional order size

incrementDigits.description: Number of digits for price increment

get.description:
Returns both contract info and rules from a single endpoint.
For only contract rules, use the endpoint /iserver/contract/rules.
For only contract info, use the endpoint /iserver/contract/{conid}/info.

parameters.name: isBuy
parameters.description: Side of the market rules apply too. Set to **true** for Buy Orders, set to **false** for Sell Orders

expiry_full.description: Expiration Date in the format YYYYMMDD

maturity_date.description: Date on which the underlying transaction settles if the option is exercised

industry.description: Specific group of companies or businesses.

valid_exchanges.description: Comma separated list of exchanges or trading venues

allow_sell_long.description: Allowed to sell shares that you own

local_symbol.description: Contracts symbol from primary exchange. For options it is the OCC symbol.

underlying_con_id.description: IBKRs contract identifier for the underlying instrument

r_t_h.description: Provides trading outside of Regular Trading Hours

multiplier.description: numerical value of each point of price movement

strike.description: fixed price at which the owner of the option buys or sells the underlying

right.description: Put or Call of the option

contract_month.description: Month the contract must be satisfied by making or accepting delivery

exchange.description: Primary Exchange, Routing or Trading Venue

0.description: List of Accounts that can be traded

error.description: Returns a description on any errors with order presets

0.description: order types that support IB Algos
order types that support fractional trades
order types that support cash quantity trades

orderDefaults.description: If object returned will provide the defaults based on user settings

0.description: order types that support outside of regular trading hours
Time in Force values, formatted with o for supporting Outside regular trading hours and a for Algo trading

orderOrigination.description: Order origin designation for US securities options and Options Clearing Corporation

fraqInt.description: decimal places for fractional order size

incrementDigits.description: Number of digits for price increment

get.description: Returns an object contains four lists contain all parameters for scanners

post.description: Searches for contracts according to the filters specified in scanner/params endpoint

conidex.description: conid and exchange. Format supports conid or conid@exchange

get.description:
Returns an object containing PnL for the selected account and its models (if any).
To receive streaming PnL the endpoint /ws can be used. Refer to [Streaming WebSocket Data](https://interactivebrokers.github.io/cpwebapi/RealtimeSubscription.html) for details.

200.description: An object containing account and model(s) pnl

ID.description: unique way to reference this notification

FC.description: FYI code, we can use it to find whether the disclaimer is accepted or not in settings

start.description: start date of a period. for example 20180808-0400

end.description: end date of a period. for example 20180808-0400

data.description: will be different for different event types

crossCurrency.description: Defines if a derivative contract has a different currency.

chineseName.description: HTML encoded company description in Chinese.

allExchanges.description: List of exchanges and venues contract trades.

assetClass.description: Group of financial instruments which have similar financial characteristics and behave similar in the marketplace.

lastTradingDay.description: Final day derivative contract can be traded before delivery of the underlying asset or cash settlement.

putOrCall.description: Defines the right to buy or sell of the underlying security.

strike.description: Set price at which a derivative contract can be bought or sold.

multiplier.description: Multiplier for total premium paid or received for derivative contract.

fullName.description: Formatted company name with underlying symbol, expiration, strike, right.

isUS.description: If contract is a US contract. Currently supported for stocks, options and warrants.

lowerEdge.description: The minimum contract price on the market that supports the specified increment.

increment.description: The minimum increment value for contract price.

stocks.description: This is an array of object(s), there could be multiple results under same symbol

contracts.description: array of contracts from different exchanges

open.description: First price returned for bar value.

startTime.description: Start Time in the format YYYYMMDD.

startTimeVal.description: Start Time Value - Formatted in unix time in ms.

endTime.description: End Time in the format YYYYMMDD.

endTimeVal.description: End Time Value - Formatted in unix time in ms.

t.description: Time - Formatted in unix time in ms.

o.description: Open - First price returned for bar value.

c.description: Close - Last price returned for bar value.

h.description: High - High price returned for bar value.

l.description: Low - Last price returned for bar value.

v.description: Volume - Traded volume for bar value.

mktDataDelay.description: If 0 then data is returned in real time. Otherwise will return the number of seconds history data is delayed.

position.description: Number of shares or quantity of the position.

lastShares.description: Quantity of the last partial fill

lastPrice.description: Price of the last partial fill

txTime.description: Time of transaction in GMT, format YYYYMMDD-hh:m:ss

rcptTime.description: Time of receipt in GMT, format YYYYMMDD-hh:mm:ss

P.description: Object, payload depends on event type. See confluence page for IGEvntUpd.

31.description:
Last Price - The last price at which the contract traded. May contain one of the following prefixes:
  * C - Previous day's closing price.
  * H - Trading has halted.

82.description: Change - The difference between the last price and the close on the previous trading day

83.description: Change % - The difference between the last price and the close on the previous trading day in percentage.

84.description: Bid Price - The highest-priced bid on the contract.

85.description: Ask Size - The number of contracts or shares offered at the ask price. For US stocks, the number displayed is divided by 100.

86.description: Ask Price - The lowest-priced offer on the contract.

87.description: Volume - Volume for the day, formatted with 'K' for thousands or 'M' for millions. For higher precision volume refer to field 7762.

88.description: Bid Size - The number of contracts or shares bid for at the bid price. For US stocks, the number displayed is divided by 100.

6509.description:
Market Data Availability. The field may contain three chars. First char defines: R = RealTime, D = Delayed,
Z = Frozen, Y = Frozen Delayed, N = Not Subscribed. Second char defines: P = Snapshot, p = Consolidated.
Third char defines: B = Book
  * RealTime - Data is relayed back in real time without delay, market data subscription(s) are required.
  * Delayed - Data is relayed back 15-20 min delayed.
  * Frozen - Last recorded data at market close, relayed back in real time.
  * Frozen Delayed - Last recorded data at market close, relayed back delayed.
  * Not Subscribed - User does not have the required market data subscription(s) to relay back either real time or delayed data.
  * Snapshot - Snapshot request is available for contract.
  * Consolidated - Market data is aggregated across multiple exchanges or venues.
  * Book - Top of the book data is available for contract.

7057.description: Ask Exch - Displays the exchange(s) offering the SMART price. A=AMEX, C=CBOE, I=ISE, X=PHLX, N=PSE, B=BOX, Q=NASDAQOM, Z=BATS, W=CBOE2, T=NASDAQBX, M=MIAX, H=GEMINI, E=EDGX, J=MERCURY

7058.description: Last Exch - Displays the exchange(s) offering the SMART price. A=AMEX, C=CBOE, I=ISE, X=PHLX, N=PSE, B=BOX, Q=NASDAQOM, Z=BATS, W=CBOE2, T=NASDAQBX, M=MIAX, H=GEMINI, E=EDGX, J=MERCURY

7059.description: Last Size - The number of unites traded at the last price

7068.description: Bid Exch - Displays the exchange(s) offering the SMART price. A=AMEX, C=CBOE, I=ISE, X=PHLX, N=PSE, B=BOX, Q=NASDAQOM, Z=BATS, W=CBOE2, T=NASDAQBX, M=MIAX, H=GEMINI, E=EDGX, J=MERCURY

7282.description: Average Volume - The average daily trading volume over 90 days.

7283.description:
Option Implied Vol. % - A prediction of how volatile an underlying will be in the future.
At the market volatility estimated for a maturity thirty calendar days forward of the current trading day, and based on option prices from two consecutive expiration months.

7286.description: Dividend Amount - Displays the amount of the next dividend.

7287.description:
Dividend Yield % - This value is the toal of the expected dividend payments over the next twelve months per share divided by the Current Price and is expressed as a percentage.
For derivatives, this displays the total of the expected dividend payments over the expiry date.

7293.description: 52 Week High - The highest price for the past 52 weeks.

7294.description: 52 Week Low - The lowest price for the past 52 weeks.

7635.description: Mark - The mark price is, the ask price if ask is less than last price, the bid price if bid is more than the last price, otherwise it's equal to last price

7644.description: Shortable - Describes the level of difficulty with which the security can be sold short.

7681.description: Price/EMA(20) - Price to Exponential moving average (N=20) ratio -1, displayed in percents.

7698.description:
Last Yield - Implied yield of the bond if it is purchased at the current last price. Last yield is calculated using the Last price on all possible call dates.
It is assumed that prepayment occurs if the bond has call or put provisions and the issuer can offer a lower coupon rate based on current market rates.
The yield to worst will be the lowest of the yield to maturity or yield to call (if the bond has prepayment provisions). Yield to worse may be the same as yield to maturity but never higher.

7699.description:
Bid Yield - Implied yield of the bond if it is purchased at the current bid price. Bid yield is calculated using the Ask on all possible call dates.
It is assumed that prepayment occurs if the bond has call or put provisions and the issuer can offer a lower coupon rate based on current market rates.
The yield to worst will be the lowest of the yield to maturity or yield to call (if the bond has prepayment provisions). Yield to worse may be the same as yield to maturity but never higher.

7718.description: Beta - Beta is against standard index.

7720.description:
Ask Yield - Implied yield of the bond if it is purchased at the current offer. Ask yield is calculated using the Bid on all possible call dates.
It is assumed that prepayment occurs if the bond has call or put provisions and the issuer can offer a lower coupon rate based on current market rates.
The yield to worst will be the lowest of the yield to maturity or yield to call (if the bond has prepayment provisions). Yield to worse may be the same as yield to maturity but never higher.

7992.description: 26 Week High - The highest price for the past 26 weeks.

7993.description: 26 Week Low - The lowest price for the past 26 weeks.

7994.description: 13 Week High - The highest price for the past 13 weeks.

7995.description: 13 Week Low - The lowest price for the past 13 weeks.

BboExchange.description: Color for Best Bid/Offer Exchange in hex code

HasDelayed.description: If market data field values return delayed

TimestampBase.description: Base time stamp for last update in format YYYYMMDD

instrument.description: Contains an instrument, which to scan for. For example - "STK"

type.description: Specify the scan type to use. For example - "MOST_ACTIVE_USD"

location.description: Contains location code, where to look for specified instrument. For example - "STK.US.MAJOR"

filter.description: Contains list of filters supported for the scanner

items.description: Contains list of supported filters. The code of the filter along with user-specified value has to be sued to apply a filter to scanner query. For example - [{"code":"usdVolume","value":500}]. You can also specify multiple filters - "filter":[{"code":"value"},{"code":"value"},{"code":"value"}]

Contracts.description: Contains list of contracts matching the scanner query

dates.description: array of dates, the length should be same as the length of returns inside data.

returns.description: each value stands for price change percent of corresponding date in dates array

dates.description: array of dates, the length should be same as the length of returns inside data.

returns.description: each value stands for price change percent of corresponding date in dates array

nav.description: Net asset value data for the account or consolidated accounts. NAV data is not applicable to benchmarks.

dates.description: array of dates, the length should be same as the length of returns inside data.

returns.description: each value stands for price change percent of corresponding date in dates array

includesRealTime.description: Indicates whether current day and realtime data is included in the result

from.description: Period start date. Epoch time, GMT

to.description: Period end date. Epoch time, GMT

fxRate.description: Conversion rate from asset currency to response currency

date.description: Date of transaction.  Epoch time, GMT

type.description:
Transaction Type Name: Examples: "Sell", "Buy", "Corporate Action",
"Dividend Payment", "Transfer", "Payment in Lieu"
Dividends and Transfers do not have price and quantity in response

qty.description: Not applicable for all transaction types

pr.description: In asset currency. Not be applicable for all transaction types.

amt.description:
Raw value, no formatting. Net transaction amount (may include commission, tax).
In asset currency

accountId.example: U12345678 for Individual Live Accounts, DU12345678 for Individual Paper Accounts

displayName.description: Whichever value is not null in this priority

accountAlias.description: User customizable account alias. Refer to [Configure Account Alias](https://guides.interactivebrokers.com/cp/cp.htm#am/settings/accountalias.htm) for details.

accountStatus.description: When the account was opened in unix time.

faclient.description: If an account is a sub-account to a Financial Advisor.

clearingStatus.description:
Status of the Account
  * O = Open
  * P or N = Pending
  * A = Abandoned
  * R = Rejected
  * C = Closed

accountId.description: Account Number for Money Manager Client

isMultiplex.description: Is a Multiplex Account. These are account models with individual account being parent and managed account being child.

orderId.description: orderId is required when modifying alert. You can get it from /iserver/account/:accountId/alerts

alertMessage.description: The message you want to receive via email or text message

alertRepeatable.description: whether alert is repeatable or not, so value can only be 0 or 1, this has to be 1 for MTA alert

sendMessage.description: whether allowing to send email or not, so value can only be 0 or 1,

tif.description: time in force, can only be GTC or GTD

expireTime.description: format, YYYYMMDD-HH:mm:ss, please NOTE this will only work when tif is GTD

outsideRth.description: value can only be 0 or 1, set to 1 if the alert can be triggered outside regular trading hours.

iTWSOrdersOnly.description: value can only be 0 or 1, set to 1 to enable the alert only in IBKR mobile

showPopup.description: value can only be 0 or 1, set to 1 to allow to show alert in pop-ups

toolId.description: for MTA alert only, each user has a unique toolId and it will stay the same, do not send for normal alert

playAudio.description: audio message to play when alert is triggered

type.description: Types: 1-Price, 3-Time, 4-Margin, 5-Trade, 6-Volume, 7: MTA market 8: MTA Position, 9: MTA Acc. Daily PN&

conidex.description: conid and exchange. Format supports conid or conid@exchange

operator.description: optional, operator for the current condition, can be >= or <=

triggerMethod.description: optional, only some type of conditions have triggerMethod

value.description: can not be empty, can pass default value "*"

logicBind.description:
"a" means "AND", "o" means "OR", "n" means "END",
the last one condition in the condition array should "n"

timeZone.description: only needed for some MTA alert condition

alert_message.description: The message you want to receive via email or text message

alert_active.description: whether alert is active or not, so value can only be 0 or 1

alert_repeatable.description: whether alert is repeatable or not, so value can only be 0 or 1

alert_send_message.description: whether allowing to send email or not, so value can only be 0 or 1,

tif.description: time in force, can only be GTC or GTD

outsideRth.description: value can only be 0 or 1, set to 1 if the alert can be triggered outside regular trading hours.

itws_orders_only.description: value can only be 0 or 1, set to 1 to enable the alert only in IBKR mobile

alert_show_popup.description: value can only be 0 or 1, set to 1 to allow to show alert in pop-ups

alert_triggered.description: whether the alert has been triggered

order_not_editable.description: whether the alert can be edited

tool_id.description: for MTA alert only, each user has a unique toolId and it will stay the same, do not send for normal alert

alert_play_audio.description: audio message to play when alert is triggered

condition_outside_rth.description: whether allowing the condition can be triggered outside of regular trading hours, 1 means allow

condition_type.description: Types: 1-Price, 3-Time, 4-Margin, 5-Trade, 6-Volume, 7: MTA market 8: MTA Position, 9: MTA Acc. Daily PN&

conidex.description: conid and exchange. Format supports conid or conid@exchange

condition_operator.description:
optional, operator for the current condition
  * >= Greater than or equal to
  * <= Less than or equal to

condition_trigger_method.description: optional, only some type of conditions have triggerMethod

condition_value.description: can not be empty, can pass default value "*"

condition_logic_bind.description:
Condition array should end with "n"
  * a - AND
  * o - OR
  * n - END

condition_time_zone.description: only needed for some MTA alert condition

competing.description: Brokerage session is competing, e.g. user is logged in to IBKR Mobile, WebTrader, TWS or other trading platforms.

message.description: System messages that may affect trading

prompts.description: Prompt messages that may affect trading or the account

contract.description: Contains all details of the contract, including rules you can use when placing orders

r_t_h.description: true means you can trade outside RTH(regular trading hours)

items.description: store available order types for this contract
store available order types for this contract outside regular hours

defaultSize.description: default quantity you can use to place an order

limitPrice.description: default limit price you can use to prefill your order

stopprice.description: default stop price you can use to prefill your order

preview.description: if you can preview the order or not with the whatif endpoint

secdef-info.description: Contains some basic info of contract

exchange.description: Primary Exchange, Routing or Trading Venue

right.description: Put or Call of the option. C = Call Option, P = Put Option

strike.description: Set price at which a derivative contract can be bought or sold. The strike price also known as exercise price.

cusip.description: Committee on Uniform Securities Identification Procedures number

coupon.description: Annual interest rate paid on a bond

desc1.description: Currency pairs for Forex e.g. EUR.AUD, EUR.CAD, EUR.CHF etc.

maturityDate.description: Format YYYYMMDD, the date on which the underlying transaction settles if the option is exercised

multiplier.description: Multiplier for total premium paid or received for derivative contract.

validExchanges.description: Comma separated list of exchanges or trading venues.

priceFactor.description: priceFactor is price increment obtained from display rule

startTime.description: start date time in the format YYYYMMDD-HH:mm:ss

high.description:
High value during this time series with format %h/%v/%t. %h is the high price (scaled by priceFactor), %v is volume
(volume factor will always be 100 (reported volume = actual volume/100)) and %t is minutes from start time of the chart

low.description:
Low value during this time series with format %l/%v/%t. %l is the low price (scaled by priceFactor), %v is volume
(volume factor will always be 100 (reported volume = actual volume/100)) and %t is minutes from start time of the chart

timePeriod.description: The duration for the historical data request

barLength.description: The number of seconds in a bar

mdAvailability.description:
Market Data Availability. The field may contain two chars. The first char is the primary code: S = Streaming, R = Realtime, D = Delayed,
Z = Frozen, Y = Frozen Delayed. The second char is the secondary code: P = Snapshot Available, p = Consolidated.

mktDataDelay.description: The time it takes, in milliseconds, to process the historical data request

outsideRth.description: The historical data returned includes outside of regular trading hours

tradingDayDuration.description: The number of seconds in the trading day

side.description:
The side of the market of the order.
  * B - Buy contract near posted ask price
  * S - Sell contract near posted bid price
  * X - Option expired

order_description.description: Formatted description of the order "%side% %size% @ %price% on %exchange%".

trade_time.description: Time of Status update in format "YYYYMMDD-hh:mm:ss".

trade_time_r.description: Time of status update in format unix time.

order_ref.description: User defined string used to identify the order. Value is set using "cOID" field while placing an order.

net_amount.description: Net cost of the order, including contract multiplier and quantity.

conidex.description: conid and exchange. Format supports conid or conid@exchange

position.description: Total quantity owned for this contract

clearing_id.description: Firm which will settle the trade. For IBExecution customers only.

clearing_name.description: Specifies the true beneficiary of the order. For IBExecution customers only.

liquidation_trade.description: If order adds liquidity to the market.

ticker.description: The ticker symbol of the original place order

tif.description: Specify a time in force to change how long your order will continue to work in the market

quantity.description: usually integer, for some special cases can be float numbers

deactivated.description:
Set to true if you want to pause a working order.
For details refer to the [TWS Users' Guide:](https://guides.interactivebrokers.com/tws/twsguide.html#usersguidebook/getstarted/pause_execution.htm)

acctId.description:
acctId is optional. It should be one of the accounts returned by
/iserver/accounts. If not passed, the first one in the list is selected.

conid.description:
conid is the identifier of the security you want to trade, you can find the
conid with /iserver/secdef/search.

conidex.description: Conid and Exchange - Can be used instead of conid when specifying the contract identifier of a security.

secType.description: The contract-identifier (conid) and security type (type) specified as a concatenated value, conid:type

cOID.description:
Customer Order ID. An arbitrary string that can be used to identify the order, e.g "my-fb-order". The
value must be unique for a 24h span. Please do not set this value for child orders when placing a bracket order.

parentId.description: Only specify for child orders when placing bracket orders. The parentId for the child order(s) must be equal to the cOId (customer order id) of the parent.

orderType.description:
The order-type determines what type of order you want to send.
  * LMT - A limit order is an order to buy or sell at the specified price or better.
  * MKT - A market order is an order to buy or sell at the markets current NBBO.
  * STP - A stop order becomes a market order once the specified stop price is attained or penetrated.
  * STOP_LIMIT - A stop limit order becomes a limit order once the specified stop price is attained or penetrated.
  * MIDPRICE - A MidPrice order attempts to fill at the current midpoint of the NBBO or better.
  * TRAIL - A sell trailing stop order sets the stop price at a fixed amount below the market price with an attached "trailing" amount. See more details here: https://ndcdyn.interactivebrokers.com/en/index.php?f=605
  * TRAILLMT - A trailing stop limit order is designed to allow an investor to specify a limit on the maximum possible loss, without setting a limit on the maximum possible gain.
    See more details here: https://ndcdyn.interactivebrokers.com/en/index.php?f=606

listingExchange.description:
listingExchange is optional. By default we use "SMART" routing. Possible values are available via the endpoint: /iserver/contract/{conid}/info,
see **valid_exchange** e.g: SMART,AMEX,NYSE,CBOE,ISE,CHX,ARCA,ISLAND,DRCTEDGE,BEX,BATS,EDGEA,CSFBALGO,JE FFALGO,BYX,IEX,FOXRIVER,TPLUS1,NYSENAT,PSX

isSingleGroup.description: set to true if you want to place a single group orders(OCA)

outsideRTH.description: set to true if the order can be executed outside regular trading hours.

price.description: optional if order is LMT, or STOP_LIMIT, this is the limit price. For STP|TRAIL this is the stop price. For MIDPRICE this is the option price cap.

auxPrice.description: optional if order is STOP_LIMIT|TRAILLMT, this is the stop price. You must specify both price and auxPrice for STOP_LIMIT|TRAILLMT orders.

ticker.description: This is the  underlying symbol for the contract.

tif.description:
The Time-In-Force determines how long the order remains active on the market.
  * GTC - use Good-Till-Cancel for orders to remain active until it executes or cancelled.
  * OPG - use Open-Price-Guarantee for Limit-On-Open (LOO) or Market-On-Open (MOO) orders.
  * DAY - if not executed a Day order will automatically cancel at the end of the markets regular trading hours.
  * IOC - any portion of an Immediate-or-Cancel order that is not filled as soon as it becomes available in the market is cancelled.

trailingAmt.description:
optional if order is TRAIL, or TRAILLMT. When trailingType is amt, this is the trailing amount, when trailingType is %, it means percentage.
You must specify both trailingType and trailingAmt for TRAIL and TRAILLMT order

trailingType.description:
This is the trailing type for trailing amount. We only support two types here: amt or %.
You must specify both trailingType and trailingAmt for TRAIL and TRAILLMT order

quantity.description:
Usually integer, for some special cases such as fractional orders can specify as a float, e.g. quantity = 0.001.
In some special cases quantity is not specified, such as when using 'cashQty' or 'fxQty'.

cashQty.description:
Cash Quantity - used to specify the monetary value of an order instead of the number of shares. When using 'cashQty' don't specify 'quantity'
Orders that express size using a monetary value, e.g. cash quantity can result in fractional shares and are provided on a non-guaranteed basis.
The system simulates the order by canceling it once the specified amount is spent (for buy orders) or collected (for sell orders).
In addition to the monetary value, the order uses a maximum size that is calculated using the Cash Quantity Estimated Factor, which can be modified in Order Presets.

fxQty.description: double number, this is the cash quantity field which can only be used for Currency Conversion Orders. When using 'fxQty' don't specify 'quantity'.

useAdaptive.description:
If true, the system will use the Price Management Algo to submit the order.
https://www.interactivebrokers.com/en/index.php?f=43423

isCcyConv.description: set to true if the order is a FX conversion order

allocationMethod.description:
Set the allocation method when placing an order using an FA account for a group
Possible allocation methods are "NetLiquidity", "AvailableEquity", "EqualQuantity" and "PctChange".

strategy.description: Specify which IB Algo algorithm to use for this order.

strategyParameters.description: The IB Algo parameters for the specified algorithm.

order.description: contains all the order related info

status.description:
* PendingSubmit - Indicates the order was sent, but confirmation has not been received that it has been received by the destination.
                  Occurs most commonly if an exchange is closed.
* PendingCancel - Indicates that a request has been sent to cancel an order but confirmation has not been received of its cancellation. * PreSubmitted - Indicates that a simulated order type has been accepted by the IBKR system and that this order has yet to be elected.
                 The order is held in the IBKR system until the election criteria are met. At that time the order is transmitted to the order destination as specified.
* Submitted - Indicates that the order has been accepted at the order destination and is working. * Cancelled - Indicates that the balance of the order has been confirmed cancelled by the IB system.
              This could occur unexpectedly when IB or the destination has rejected the order.
* Filled - Indicates that the order has been completely filled. * Inactive - Indicates the order is not working, for instance if the order was invalid and triggered an error message,
             or if the order was to short a security and shares have not yet been located.

parentId.description: Only exists in child order of bracket

order_ref.description: User defined string used to identify the order. Value is set using "cOID" field while placing an order.

order-status.description: contains all the details of an order

order_id.description: system generated order id, unique per account

conidex.description: conid and exchange. Format supports conid or conid@exchange

side.description:
The side of the market of the order.
  * B - Buy contract near posted ask price
  * S - Sell contract near posted bid price
  * X - Option expired

order_status.description:
*  PendingSubmit - Indicates the order was sent, but confirmation has not been received that it has been received by the destination.
                   Occurs most commonly if an exchange is closed.
*  PendingCancel - Indicates that a request has been sent to cancel an order but confirmation has not been received of its cancellation. *  PreSubmitted - Indicates that a simulated order type has been accepted by the IBKR system and that this order has yet to be elected.
                  The order is held in the IBKR system until the election criteria are met. At that time the order is transmitted to the order destination as specified.
*  Submitted - Indicates that the order has been accepted at the order destination and is working. *  Cancelled - Indicates that the balance of the order has been confirmed cancelled by the IB system.
               This could occur unexpectedly when IB or the destination has rejected the order.
*  Filled - Indicates that the order has been completely filled. *  Inactive - Indicates the order is not working, for instance if the order was invalid and triggered an error message,
              or if the order was to short a security and shares have not yet been located.

tif.description: Time-in-Force - length of time order will continue working before it is canceled.

order_not_editable.description: If true not allowed to modify order

editable_fields.description: Fields that can be edited in escaped unicode characters

cannot_cancel_order.description: If true not allowed to cancel order

outside_rth.description: If true order trades outside regular trading hours

use_price_mgmt_algo.description: If true price management algo is enabled, refer to https://www.interactivebrokers.com/en/index.php?f=43423

exit_strategy_chart_description.description: Position description to display on chart

exit_strategy_tool_availability.description: * 1: If your account has position or order for contract * 0: If your account has no position or order for contract

allowed_duplicate_opposite.description: Returns true if contract supports duplicate/opposite side order.

order_time.description: Time of status update in unix time

oca_group_id.description: only exists for oca orders, oca orders in same group will have same id
